title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that at 40 units the firm’s economic profit is positive and/or does not explain that the price is above the ATC.
The response states that at 40 units the firm’s economic profit is positive and explains that the price is above the ATC.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that the firm should increase its price and/or does not explain that when demand is inelastic (the portion of the demand curve where marginal revenue is less than zero), a higher price leads to more total revenue, or at $40 the firm produces the quantity where marginal revenue is zero and total revenue is maximized.

The response states that the firm should increase its price and explains that when demand is inelastic (the portion of the demand curve where marginal revenue is less than zero), a higher price leads to more total revenue, or at $40 the firm produces the quantity where marginal revenue is zero and total revenue is maximized.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that deadweight loss decreases and/or does not explain that the firm produces closer to the allocatively efficient quantity, where marginal cost equals price.
The response states that deadweight loss decreases and explains that the firm produces closer to the allocatively efficient quantity, where marginal cost equals price.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does none of the following:

· Identifies that the firm’s profit-maximizing quantity is 30 units and explains that at that quantity marginal revenue is equal to marginal cost.

· Identifies that the firm’s profit-maximizing price is $56 and explains that it is the price on the demand curve at the profit-maximizing quantity (where marginal revenue is equal to marginal cost).

The response does both of the following:

· Identifies that the firm’s profit-maximizing quantity is 30 units and explains that at that quantity marginal revenue is equal to marginal cost.

· Identifies that the firm’s profit-maximizing price is $56 and explains that it is the price on the demand curve at the profit-maximizing quantity (where marginal revenue is equal to marginal cost).

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate the total cost as $1,440 and/or does not show the work.

Total Cost = Average Total Cost ×Quantity = $48 ×30=$1440 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@67C3@

The response calculates total cost as $1,440 and shows the work.

Total Cost = Average Total Cost ×Quantity = $48 ×30=$1440 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@67C3@
